name: Cook the Book: Beijing Hot Noodles
description: These Beijing Hot Noodles adapted for Heather Shouse's Food Trucks come from Yue Kee, a Chinese food truck parked on 38th Street in Philadelphia. An initial glance at the menu might not be too promising, with uninspired Chinese American standards like chicken and broccoli—but further investigation of the menu reveals Cantonese, Sichuan, and Hunan classics all executed well.
recipeIngredient: 1 (12-ounce) package firm tofu, drained and cubed
1/2 teaspoon ground white or black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in a wok or heavy, deep sauté pan over high heat for 1 minute. Add the garlic and ginger and sauté for 2 minutes. Add the green onions and ground pork and cook until the pork is browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the ground bean sauce, tofu, chile oil, salt, and sugar and toss to coat, cooking for 2 to 3 minutes more. Add the sesame oil and pepper, stir, and turn off the heat.
Divide the lo mein noodles among individual plates, place the cucumber alongside, and top the noodles with the pork and tofu mixture. Serve immediately.
